result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce D Hady

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK] cases #21CF354, #22CF90 called at 12:08pm 
Defendant Bruce D. Hady in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Huebner reports that the DA's Office has rejected a Treatment Court option.  Attorney Huebner now wants to obtain and provide to the prosecutor with records of treatment Mr. Hady has been undergoing.  Attorney Huebner requests a relatively fast turn-around hearing date. He intends to further negotiate the case with the prosecutor. 
ADA Witt indicates that State is requesting the scheduling of a trial. 
recess 12:10pm 

NEXT:  Status Conference (possible plea/sent) on November 15th at 11:00am (JA-note in comments that if cases ares not resolving at this point, the Court intends to schedule trial)
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF90, 21CF354, 21CF353, 22CF92 called at 10:58 AM 
Defendant Bruce D Hady in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Bruce D Hady.  
Defendant Jacob L Whittle in court. Attorney Peter Anderson in court for Jacob L Whittle.
Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Huebner requests an additional status be scheduled, to allow Mr. Hady to apply for treatment court. 
Atty Anderson indicates that resolution has been reached, requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled. 

recess: 11:01am 
NEXT: As to Hady, Status on 11/1/22 at 11:30am 
As to Whittle, Plea & Sentencing on 11/1/22 at 11:30am
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[MK] cases #21CF353, #21CF354, #22CF90, #22CF92 called at 9:52am 
Co-Defendant Bruce D Hady in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.
Co-Defendant Jacob L. Whittle in court with Attorney Peter Anderson
ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

In Case #22CF90  (Hady) Prelim-Waiver is held: 
--Mr. Hady waives his right to Preliminary Hearing.  The Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for trial 

In both Case #22CF90 (Hady) and #22CF92 (Whittle) Arraignment is held: 
--Service of Information is admitted by each Co-Defendant; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
--In Case #22CF90(Hady)  Plea of "not guilty" is entered
--in Case #22CF92 (Whittle) the Defense stands mute. The Court enters a plea of "Not Guilty" on the Defendant's behalf. 
In response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trials.
recess 9:57am

NEXT:  Status Conference on September 15th at 10:30am
Post Hearing//Off Record: The Court uses the zoom chat function to relay to Mr. Hady that his next court date is 8/19/22 at 9:00am

[ma] Cases 21CF353, 22CF92(Whittle) & 22CF90,21CF354(Hady) called at 9:48am 
 Defendant Jacob L Whittle appears via zoom.   Attorney Lane Fitzgerald appears via zoom for Jacob L Whittle. Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Bruce D Hady does not appear, but was appearing via zoom at scheduled 9:00am court time. Attorney Karl Huebner does not appear (is currently held up in another courtroom)

The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

As to Case 22CF92, Waiver of Preliminary Hearing occurs: 
Mr. Whittle waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

recess: 9:57am  

NEXT:   As to Case 22CF90(Hady), Arraignment on 8/19/22 at 9:00am

As to Case 21CF353(Whittle), Status on 8/19/22 at 9:00am

[MK] cases #21CF353, #21CF354, #22CF90, #22CF92 called at 10:10am 
Co-Defendant Bruce D Hady in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. (Attorney Huebner indicates that PD appointment of counsel is forthcoming in Case #22CF90)
Co-Defendant Jacob L Whittle in court with Attorney Peter Anderson. (Attorney Anderson indicates he anticipates being appointed as PD counsel in Case #22CF92)
ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Initial Appearance is held in Case #22CF92 [Co-Defendant Whittle] 
---the Court vacates the previous warrant authorization   
---Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the Count #2 charge and maximum penalties are recited
---Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
---The Court requires a $1,500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
---no contact with the individual who is alleged as the informant in the Criminal Complaint
---no contact with Co-Defendant Bruce D Hady 

Mr. Whittle provides an updated address of:  718 N. Water Street, Watertown 53098

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on April 20th at 8:30am (Hady ) and at 11:40 (Whittle),  (2) Status Conference on all four cases on June 16th at 10:30am [JA- note in comments for Cases #22CF90 and #22CF92 that those cases are at prelim stage]
Copy of Criminal Complaint faxed to Gimbal, Reilly, Guerin, Brown per phone request//ma
Status conference on April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ae] cases 22CF90 and 22CF92 called 10:56 AM Defendant Bruce D Hady in court. Defendant Jacob L Whittle not in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to 22CF90: The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1500  Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--no contact with co-defendant or PI 1400
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 11:01 am
NEXT: (1) Status Conference on 4/7/22 at 10:00 am

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
As to 22CF92

recess 11:00 am
